metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000168 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
nghttp2 version >= 1.10.0 and nghttp2 <= v1.31.0 contains an Improper Input Validation CWE-20 vulnerability in ALTSVC frame handling that can result in segmentation fault leading to denial of service. This attack appears to be exploitable via network client. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in >= 1.31.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnghttp2-14 - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1
nghttp2 - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1
nghttp2-client - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1
nghttp2-proxy - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1
nghttp2-server - 1.30.0-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Affected versions: nghttp2 >= 1.10.0 and nghttp2 <= v1.31.0

criterions.comment: nghttp2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.30.0-1ubuntu1').
